channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street light not working, 14th October
item.description:
Noticed been not working since end of Sept and pitch black outside and pavements are uneven in places

item.title: Canterbury Road, 14th October
item.description:
There are now two dumped mattresses. I have previously reported a mattress dumping (the one on the right of the photo) but a second one has now joined it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gorefield Place, London

item.title: Abandoned motorcycles on public walkway, 14th October
item.description:
Previously reported - ref; 8125745 These motorcycles have been left outside my property for over 6 months. Yourselves nor Peabody want to take responsibility for their removal. I donâ€™t understand why they cannot be removed nor who is responsible. They are a fire hazard and a danger to the public
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yarnton Way, Lower Belvedere, London

item.title: Washing machine, large mattress, side tanle, 14th October
item.description:
In the very short stretch of footpath between Upper Montagu Street and Durweston Street there is a washing machine, a large mattress and a side table. There woukd be minimal cost for the Council to put up large notice on the black bins saying it is illegal to leave anything on the footpath, the only exception being bagged household rubbish by residents on their designated collection days

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, York Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are rubbish bags and cardboard dumped, 14th October

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montagu Mews West, Marylebone, London

item.category: Dead animal in the carriageway or footway

item.title: Enormous amount of rubbish in front garden / footpath, 14th October
item.description:
Large amount of rubbish has been left in view on Glasbrook Road for a considerable time now. I see this regularly when walking past. Looks like family just need some help clearing things out. Very depressing to see this in the neighbourhood.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glasbrook Road, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
